intro: Legrandia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be found in various habitats, including woodlands and meadows. Legrandia species often have opposite leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. The genus is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
